Class Officer

java.lang.Object
BTO.Users
BTO.Applicant
BTO.Officer
All Implemented Interfaces:
Admin, Search<String>
public class Officer extends Applicant implements Admin
Represents a user with officer-level permissions in the BTO system. Officers are specialised users who inherit from Applicant and are authorised to manage BTO applications, reply to enquiries, book flats on behalf of applicants, and access booking and enquiry workflows. Officers can:
  • Apply to become BTO officers
  • Be appointed as managing officers
  • Facilitate the booking process
  • View and respond to user enquiries
Officers are assigned to projects dynamically, and also interact with other users through the shared BTO interface. Implements Search and Admin interfaces. Authorised operations depend on role and project assignment.
Author:
Kah Teck, Keanan, Javier, Junnoske, Kevin

  • Constructor Details

    • Officer

      public Officer(String nric, String name, int age, String password, boolean married)
      Constructs a new officer user. Officer inherits applicant-level permissions and is initialised with officer-specific role.
      Parameters:
      nric - the NRIC of the officer
      name - the name of the officer
      age - the age of the officer
      password - the officer’s login password
      married - the marital status of the officer

  • Method Details

    • getManaging

      public List<Integer> getManaging()
      Returns the list of BTO IDs the officer is currently managing.
      Returns:
      a list of BTO project IDs

    • getOfficerApp

      public List<Integer> getOfficerApp()
      Returns the list of BTO project IDs the officer has applied to manage.
      Returns:
      a list of BTO project IDs for officer applications

    • addManagingBTO

      public void addManagingBTO(int btoId)
      Adds a BTO project ID to the officer's list of managing projects.
      Parameters:
      btoId - the BTO project ID

    • canApplyOfficer

      public boolean canApplyOfficer(BTO bto, boolean clash)
      Checks whether the officer is eligible to apply to manage a BTO project.
      Parameters:
      bto - the BTO project to evaluate
      clash - whether the application period clashes with an existing assignment
      Returns:
      true if officer is eligible, false otherwise

    • createOfficerApplication

      public Application createOfficerApplication(BTO bto, boolean clash)
      Creates an officer application for the given BTO project if eligible.
      Parameters:
      bto - the BTO project to apply for
      clash - whether the project clashes with other assigned periods
      Returns:
      a new Application object if valid; null otherwise

    • clashApplication

      public boolean clashApplication(Date start, Date end, List<Integer> btoIdList, List<BTO> btoList)
      Checks for any date overlaps between the given application dates and the officer's current managing projects.
      Parameters:
      start - the start date of the new project
      end - the end date of the new project
      btoIdList - the list of BTO IDs the officer is already assigned to
      btoList - the list of all BTO projects
      Returns:
      true if any date overlaps are found, false otherwise

    • bookBTO

      public String bookBTO(BTO bto, Application application)
      Books a room on behalf of an applicant if the application is valid and the officer is authorised. This method updates application status, reduces available units, and updates applicant profile.
      Parameters:
      bto - the BTO project associated with the booking
      application - the applicant’s application to be booked
      Returns:
      the NRIC of the applicant if booking succeeds, otherwise null

    • applicantReceipt

      public void applicantReceipt(BTO bto, Applicant applicant)
      Generates and prints a booking receipt for a given applicant and their assigned BTO project.
      Parameters:
      bto - the booked BTO project
      applicant - the applicant whose booking details are printed

    • managingBTO

      public void managingBTO(List<Integer> managingId, Project<BTO> btoProj, Project<Application> appProj, Project<Enquiries> enquiryProj) throws InputMismatchException, InvalidInput
      Menu handler for officers managing BTO projects. Officers can respond to enquiries and approve booking requests.
      Specified by:
      managingBTO in interface Admin
      Parameters:
      managingId - the list of BTO project IDs this officer manages
      btoProj - the full list of BTO projects
      appProj - the application records
      enquiryProj - the enquiry records
      Throws:
      InputMismatchException - for invalid inputs
      InvalidInput - for any domain-specific invalid selections

    • showMenu

      public void showMenu(Project<BTO> btoProj, Project<Application> appProj, Project<Enquiries> enquiryProj, List<Users> userList)
      Displays the officer's main menu and handles officer-specific workflows. Includes actions like officer application, booking confirmation, enquiry response, and password updates.
      Parameters:
      btoProj - the BTO project container
      appProj - the application container
      enquiryProj - the enquiry container
      userList - the full list of users
